comment.body:
This could use a couple more tests:

 * "Weird" argument types for subscribables, like class objects, C strings, etc.
 * Non-subscribable arguments.
 * A subscribable that sends a value upon subscription.
This method doesn't need to require `nil` termination. We have the method signature for the selector in question, so we know exactly how many arguments should be passed in here.
We should support pointer `^â€¦` arguments if possible. It'd just be unwrapping a pointer from `NSValue`.

issue.body:
`tui_makeFirstResponder:` should not check `acceptsFirstResponder`. This matches the behavior of `-[NSWindow makeFirstResponder:]`.

This reverts commit c636424772341201126bc8bea6f70f4f67b36962.

CC @galaxas0
issue.title: Revert "Take acceptsFirstResponder into account."

comment.body: Alright, I'll remember that then, thanks!

issue.body:
`tui_makeFirstResponder:` should not check `acceptsFirstResponder`. This matches the behavior of `-[NSWindow makeFirstResponder:]`.

comment.body: Read the documentation for the `NSWindow` method.
It only allows it if there's a property declaration for `vertical`. You can't call arbitrary `is` methods with dot syntax.

issue.body:
The use of `Gestalt()` was introduced in commit 2fe383482357f to see if we're running on Lion or above. As of 10.8, this function is deprecated.

`sysctl(3)` should be used instead, perhaps.
issue.title: The function "Gestalt()" is deprecated on 10.8

comment.body: `sysctl(3)` is a LOT harder than Gestalt() to check for, but sure. I'll patch that in.
It should be documented that structure and union types are unsupported.
There's still a bit of an issue here. If a subscription yields an object, we'll have filled in the non-subscribable arguments, but not necessarily the other subscribables, right?
Why not just make this an `NSInteger`, and avoid the casts below?
This block needs to be copied.

issue.body:
The use of `Gestalt()` was introduced in commit 2fe383482357f to see if we're running on Lion or above. As of 10.8, this function is deprecated.

`sysctl(3)` should be used instead, perhaps.
issue.title: The function "Gestalt()" is deprecated on 10.8

comment.body: `NSAssert2` is super old and not needed anymore. `NSAssert` should work fine.
What about something like `rac_bindSelector:toObjects:`, `rac_subscribeSelector:`, etc.? I don't like how this seems like a simple extension to `-[NSObject performSelector:withObject:]`.

issue.body:

This reverts commit c636424772341201126bc8bea6f70f4f67b36962.

comment.body:
Oh, I was unaware of that... then where _exactly_ is
`acceptsFirstResponder` used?

.... I'm only slightly stupid, I swear. I can get this fixed, but the new
Objective-C runtime *technically* alllows `-isVertical` to be used as a
property. It's bad syntax, as you said, but it works. :P

repo.name: ReactiveCocoa
repo.description: A framework for composing and transforming sequences of values.

pull_request.body: This is similar to the proxy approach that I surfaced in #63 but it actually works with non-object arguments and doesn't require nasty casting. Really handy with UIKit.

commits.message: moved to the right place and added some tests
split the trampoline into two objects
use metamacros to pair down the RAC macros
don't need the extra keypath macro anymore

Merge pull request #65 from github/derived-assignment

Derived assignment
Added a Contributing section to the README
Added a unit test to catch RACAsyncSubject in the act
Only send the lastValue if one was set

Merge pull request #68 from github/async-subject-nil-values

RACAsyncSubject should only send the last value if one was actually set

Only capture backtrace addresses initially

This speeds up RACBacktrace, because we avoid symbolication until we need it.

Merge pull request #69 from github/backtrace-performance

Only capture backtrace addresses initially
